text.p: - Christof Zernatto, head of Austria's Kaernten region, on Thursday visited Slovenian President Milan Kucan and Prime Minister Janez Drnovsek.
- Defence Minister Tit Turnsek said that even if Slovenia does not join NATO in the first round of its enlargement towards the east, it would not be a "black scenario".
- Slovenian administration bodies are too slow and there is no organised free-of-charge legal protection, human rights ombudsman Ivo Bizjak said on Thursday.
- Slovenia is presenting its tourist facilities in Japan, and plans to increase the number of Japanese visitors by 50 to 70 percent in the next two years.
- Government decided to lift prices of medicine produced in Slovenia by 7.3 percent. The increase would add 0.03 percent to the May inflation, the government said.
- Pavlicevo Sedlo in northern Slovenia will become an international border pass from April 18, Prime Minister Janez Drnovsek said.
- Listed bank Probanka said its 1996 net profit rose by about 50 percent compared to the previous year thanks to the expansion of its business abroad.
